mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to David Stuart, 1789 September 21
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
Washington, Martha, 1731-1802
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Advises Stuart, as administrator of estate of John Parke Custis, to let Mr. Alexander have disputed land [J.P. Custis' "Abingdon" estate] back and pay him a fair rent for the time it was out of his possession -- has no time to give reasons -- Martha Washington adds her approval at bottom of letter. Autograph letter signed, 1 page, laminated, watermark (encircled "CP"). Name on original manuscript appears as "G. Washington".
